revised_title: Enhancing Immunization Coverage in Developing Countries
tldr: This article discusses the challenges and strategies for improving immunization services in developing countries. It emphasizes the importance of delivering immunization services to high-risk populations, such as children under one year old and pregnant women, and integrating these services into primary health care systems. The article also highlights the need for cost-effective vaccines and addresses issues such as vaccine quality, transportation, and health education in these countries.
scientific_discipline: Medicine and Health Sciences > Public Health
